website_summaries.verdict: A relatively affordable hardtail mountain bike for beginners.
pros: Aluminum frame is durable and fairly light
Frame is compatible with dropper post (though this isn't included)
Shimano 1x9 drivetrain is simple but ideal for mountainous terrain
Hydraulic disc brakes are capable and reactive
cons: 27.5-inch wheels are small and not necessarily ideal for handling rougher terrain

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike showed up when it was supposed too, box was a little beat up and the hardware box was scattered all over the bottom, all the pieces were there I needed to assemble but nothing to worry about, normal wear and tear for getting it shipped and they wrap it so damn well that there was zero damage to the bike. Easy to set up rode around for a couple of hours and no mechanical problems. Great bike in my opinion. Will update if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Cri11z

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike for my 15 year old. He has broken two other bikes because his skill set has exceed the quality of the build of them. This bike is made for extreme biking. He jumps it, does downhill, uphill, snow, mud etc. and has had zero problems. The gears shift smoothly and silently. The hydraulic brakes are extremely responsive and allow you to stop on a dime. The aluminum frame is sturdy and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Kev840

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing bike for the price. We purchased this bike for my 10yo and he used it to mountain bike in Santa Fe NM, near Zion UT, Moab UT, Canyonlands UT, Big Bend TX along with regular neighborhood riding with friends. The guys at our local bike shop were even impressed when building it and tuning it. Definitely recommend this bike for kids as they begin to get serious about mountain biking!

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good started bike. Expect to make some upgrades or out grow it eventually. The head tube is not tapered so you’re limited if planning to upgrade from the cheap suntour coil fork to air. I was able to go tubeless with just some 1” gorilla tape, tubeless valve stems, and orange seal. I ended up getting a set of maxxis 2.5” wide tires which fit no problem. Pedals, seat, and grips aren’t great. Other than that it’s been fun.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Glassford

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike! I love it! Came on time without any damages. Quick and easy assembly. Good quality.

product_meta.title: Diamondback Bicycles Line Hardtail Mountain Bike, 120mm Travel Bike Fork, 27.5-Inch Wheels
product_meta.description: There was a time when every mountain bike was an all-around hardtail. The Line follows in that great tradition — but that doesn’t mean it’s some kind of crusty throwback. We’ve equipped the Line with a cutting-edge 6061-T6 aluminum modern frame that’s lightweight, yet stable under pressure making it the perfect mountain bike for when you’re looking to boost a little air or hit that next corner a bit faster. The frame is also compatible with internally routed dropper posts, is custom-formed, and has butted tubing for added strength. The Shimano 1×9 drivetrain lets you blaze through the gears with pinpoint precision every single time. And because we know hard-charging riders tend to gravitate to these progressive trail bikes, we’ve also added a bit more security in the form of a chain guide with roller, a capable SR Sun tour XCR 120mm travel fork (with a lock-out for those big climbing days) and powerful Shimano MT200 hydraulic disc brakes to help bring you to a stop. Although, we imagine that stopping is probably going to be the last thing you want to do when you bring this bike up to speed. Climbs, descents, berms, a bit of jumping — the Line upholds the do-it-all hardtail tradition without being traditional at all. At Diamondback, we know that a “epic ride” isn’t a destination, it’s a state of mind. Turn onto the gravel road and explore bike trails that aren’t on the app. Pack extra water and a snack in case you’re having too much fun to head home. Make epic happen. Own your adventure.
